About Punta Gorda
The name, Punta Gorda, comes from the Spanish, meaning ‚ÄúFat Point.‚Äù This historic small town is a hidden treasure of Florida and lies as a ‚ÄúFat Point‚Äù jutting out into Charlotte Harbor ‚Äì one of the US‚Äôs largest natural harbors.
Centrally located between Sarasota to our north and Fort Myers to our south, Punta Gorda is a delightful destination within a comfortable driving distance from Tampa, Orlando, and Miami.
We are blessed with Florida sunshine year-round and attract visitors and new residents alike, who come to Punta Gorda to enjoy the lifestyle we enjoy. It is a paradise for fishermen, boaters, nature-lovers, sun-worshippers, cyclists, and shoppers alike.
As the only incorporated city of Charlotte County, Florida, Punta Gorda is the vibrant engine of the area. It boasts wonderful restaurants, marinas, unique downtown shops and galleries, and a pace of life that people worldwide come to enjoy.
Punta Gorda businesses serve a year-round clientele made up of local, domestic, and international customers. Industrial growth is underway as manufacturers and distributors realizes the importance of our location in Southwest Florida. We offer a diverse commercial arena. Distribution services, construction, design, retail, hospitality and tourism, health services, life sciences, and real estate are among the largest industry sectors.

Chamber Leadership
The Punta Gorda Chamber of Commerce
is committed to improving the local business climate, because we believe that, when your business succeeds, our community also prospers.
The true value of the Chamber is its diverse membership, which is made up of both large and small businesses. There‚Äôs a lot to discover about YOUR Chamber and the many opportunities available to enhance your own business. We invite you to come and join us and to learn about how the Chamber operates to assist you.
EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
Justin Brand
President
Lee Health Foundation
(239) 343-6067
Justin is a strategic leader with over 10 years of experience in nonprofit development, community engagement, and organizational growth. As Director of Development at Golisano Children‚Äôs Hospital, he drives fundraising efforts and builds key partnerships to support impactful programs. Formerly Chief Development Officer at Charlotte Community Foundation, Justin advanced donor relations and strengthened community initiatives. Active in his community, he has served on boards including the Charlotte County Chamber of Commerce and Charlotte Estate Planning Council. Holding a Bachelor‚Äôs in Hospitality Management from SUNY Delhi, Justin is committed to creating positive change through collaboration and innovative solutions
Zarita Dixon
Secretary
Kingdom Life ‚Äì Center of H.O.P.E.
(732) 644-2691
Dr. Zarita F. Mattox-Dixon inspires others to achieve their purpose and live their best life. She is the Founder and Dean of God‚Äôs Word First School of Christian Counseling and President of The Kingdom Center for H.O.P.E. (Helping Other People Excel). Presently, Dream Chasers and Dream Maker is the Flagship program of The Kingdom Center for H.O.P.E. mentoring girls 10 years old and up. No Turning Back is a re-entry support for women coming out of prison. Dr. Zarita F. Mattox-Dixon believes that community service and involvement is an honor and a privilege and vital to every growing community.
Marjorie Benson
Past Chairwoman
Friendly Floors
(941) 624-0077
Marjorie Benson has been the owner and President of Friendly Floors for 30 years, a flooring company focused on excellence for the homeowner‚Äôs experience both in the showroom and in their own homes. Voted the #1 store for the last twenty of those years, Marjorie recently sold the business to focus on family and her passion for community involvement and support, particularly the not-for-profit sector.
Kim Weger
President Elect
Michael Saunders & CO
(941) 639-0000
With over 20 years of experience selling real estate in Punta Gorda, FL, Kim Weger offers unmatched expertise and a deep local connection. As a Managing Broker and a Broker Associate specializing in luxury properties, she provides personalized, top-tier service. Before her real estate career, Kim spent 18 years in the commercial airline industry and was able to gain a valuable education traveling the globe.
A dedicated community leader, Kim serves in key roles on the Board of Directors for the Punta Gorda Chamber, on several non-profit and community committees and as VP of Membership for Charlotte County Toastmasters International. She embraces servant leadership in all aspects of her life.
Carlton Hughes
Treasurer
Florida Premier Contractors
(941) 205-1400
Carlton Hughes is a Construction Executive with over 20 years‚Äô experience in the commercial sector.  As Partner and VP of Operations for Chalotte County based firm, FPC, Carlton has participated in some of the highest profile projects in the area.  He is a long-time supporter of the Punta Gorda Chamber and its mission to promote the expansion of business activity in the City.  Carlton lives in Punta Gorda with his wife and two daughters and can be found camping or boating in his free time.
Directors
Jacqueline Benjamin
Crews Bank & Trust
(941) 235-4444

Seasonally-adjusted real taxable sales in Charlotte County totaled $339.5 million in February 2024, down 10 percent from January 2023 and 5 percent below January 2024
Charlotte County‚Äôs unemployment rate was 3.8 percent in March 2024, unchanged from the prior month and a 0.4 percentage point increase from March 2023.
Charlotte County recorded 377 permits issued in March 2024, up 33 percent from March 2023 and 7 percent over February 2024.

ABOUT THE CHAMBER
The Punta Gorda Chamber of Commerce
is committed to improving the local business climate, because we believe that, when your business succeeds, our community also prospers.
The chamber serves businesses in three main ways:
Promotion:
We help them connect with clients and customers.
Information
:
We keep them informed about business trends and regulations, as well as happenings in our community.
Advocacy:
We are the voice of business to government officials and community leaders.
The true value of the Chamber is its diverse membership, which is made up of both large and small businesses. There‚Äôs a lot to discover about YOUR Chamber and the many opportunities available to enhance your own business. We invite you to come and join us and to learn about how the Chamber operates to assist you.
3 MONTHLY NETWORKING EVENTS
Business Over Breakfast
For the early risers, we offer a monthly Business over Breakfast (affectionately called BOB) on the second Wednesday of every month. It starts at 7.15 am and runs for approximately one hour, allowing you to get to the office on time.
Networking Luncheon
Our Networking Luncheons take place on the last Wednesday of every month and are now sell-out events. Each lunch has a business-related theme and a guest speaker. Locations rotate to various local restaurants ‚Äì check the Chamber‚Äôs events schedule for the next one.
Business After Hours
Then we have our monthly Business After Hours (BAH). The BAHs occur on the 3rd Tuesday of each month and start from 5 pm till 7 pm. A room full of people is potential clients for you.

About Charlotte County
Greater Charlotte Harbor & the Gulf Islands Area have been consistently voted the best place to live in the South.
